pages.text: $(l)The Tool Station$() is used to create any $(l)base tool:$()$(br) $(li)Pick $(li)Shovel $(li)Axe $(li)Hammer $(li)Sickle

pages.title: Tool Tiers
pages.text: The base tools are available in $(l)7 different tiers$(), gated behind Vault Level.$(br) $(li)Chromatic Iron, $(li)Chromatic Steel $(li)Black Chromatic Steel $(li)Melded $(li)Vaulterite $(li)Echoing $(li)Prismatic $(br2)The higher the tier, the more $(l)repair slots$() and the more $(l)capacity$() the tool has.

pages.title: Jewels
pages.text: Use Jewels to enhance your tool. Jewels can be crafted in the $(l)Tool Forge$() and found in $(l)Gilded Chests$() in The Vault. Jewels are found in 4 rarities: $(l)Chipped, Flawed, Flawless and Perfect$(). The rarity determines the modifiers the Jewel rolls. The Jewel's level is equal to the player's Vault Level.

pages.title: Jewels - continued
pages.text: Jewels can roll a huge variety of tool modifications. They can improve mining speed, item quantity and rarity, but they can also roll the base use of another tool. Meaning if a Jewel has the modifier $(l)axing$(), it gives the modified tool the usages of an axe. $(br2)To break certain chests in The Vault with a tool, a Jewel with chest type modification is needed, like $(l)Ornate Affinity$().

pages.title: Tool Enhancing
pages.text: Use any base tool with a jewel in an anvil to enhance the tool, as long as the tool has $(l)enough capacity$() to fit the $(l)size$() of the Jewel. If the capacity of a tool is lower than the size of a Jewel, it cannot be applied. $(br2)The $(l)level$() of the tool will be equated to the level of the Jewel it is combined with. A player is unable to use a tool if the tool has a higher level.

pages.title: Tool Appearances
pages.text: Combining a base tool with a Jewel that has another base tool's modification, it may change the $(l)appearance$() of a tool. For example, combing a Pick with an Axing Jewel (or the other way around, an Axe with a Picking Jewel), it creates a $(l)Scythe$(). There are $(l)16$() different combination tools to $(l)Collect$()
